intro: Samyda oligostemon, commonly known as the slender samyda, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a shrub or small tree native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually ovate to elliptic in shape. Its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences, typically with five petals. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
